EmailTemplate.name: CDR Webex
EmailTemplate.subject: You are invited to an ASA Update via webex!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Join ASA!
Understandng the Cohort Deafault Rate for Foreign Schools Webex
National FFELP guarantor American Student Assistance® (ASA) has designed an on-line training series to discuss some of the most pressing topics affecting U.S. financial aid at international universities. These events are designed specifically for international institutions.
Dates and Time:
Tuesday 2/17/2009 14:00 a.m. - 15:00 a.m GMT 9:00 a.m. EST - 10:00 a.m. EST
Wednesday 2/18/2009 16:00 a.m. - 17:00 p.m. GMT 11:00 a.m. EST - 12:00 p.m. EST
Course Description: FY 2007 Draft Cohort Default Rates were released on February 9 2009 to all eligible schools. Learn what’s behind your school’s Cohort Default Rate, how it affects you, and how to read your report. Topics include: Benefits and Sanctions, Challenges, Appeals, Corrections, and other actions you can take concerning your cohort default rate. Who Should Attend
Any financial aid administrator interested in the most up to date information.
How to register or for additional information.
· Register Online: 2/17/09 session at https://amsa.webex.com/amsa/onstage/g.php?t=a&d=483095086 2/18/09 session at https://amsa.webex.com/amsa/onstage/g.php?t=a&d=485143114
· Email: send your name, phone number and enrollment details to training@amsa.com
· Phone: call the Training Department at (800) 999-9080, ext. 3099 (1-617-728-4200)
All American Student Assistance training events are offered free of charge, however the dial in conference call will be at international rates for a call to the U.S.
